professional_summary: Professional with extensive experience in club and event coordination, teaching, database management, fleet administration, and project planning.

key_responsibilities: Manages the Waverly Club building and confers with GM concerning objectives
policies
and daily operations.
Manages three outdoor pool facilities and one indoor pool facility
facilitating pass registration and managing contractor and lifeguard staff.
Plans
coordinates
and implements resident programs
classes
and community-wide events.
Creates and manages contracts for residential programs.
Liaison to the Events Committee
planning and organizing multiple events annually with attendance ranging from 300 to 1200 people.
Develops and monitors the Event budget.
Submits invoices for payment and ensures timely payments.
Consults legal counsel for guidance on contracts and waivers.
Assists residents by fielding questions
responding to calls and emails
and attending Board meetings as requested.
Instructs core subjects to all grade levels in various schools.
Adheres to school standards and follows lesson plans with relevant activities.
Communicates with teachers regarding student progress and disciplinary matters.
Analyzes procurement requests and manages acquisition database.
Provides financial analysis to customers.
Coordinates with Quality Assurance for the PEO Soldier Equipment program.
Instructs core subjects in various schools.
Manages fleet utilization for 250 vehicles.
Monitors and develops operational budgets.
Manages billing reconciliation and uniform website.
Reduces fleet expenses through strategic analysis.
